HugsLib.UpdateFeatureDef.content: Check, check. *Ahem* Greetings, %username%! Many of you use HugsLib, and it allows to make a change log visible in-game. So here it comes, for yours and slightly mine convenience. If you don't have HugsLib, you'll not even notice any difference, so don't worry about it.
- added an option to prefer faster spoiling ingredients for cooking. I can't really tell, how it impacts performance. If you think it causes a lag, you may disable it.

- fixed an error on trying to cut stone chunks. Sorry about that; - added an option to unload an item from an inventory (to the closest stockpile, instead of dropping on the ground). Doesn't work with RPG Style (ATM), so probably most of you not gonna see that option anyway.

- changed pawn priorities for sleeping schedule. Now they'll prioritize topping off joy need if they happen to wake up early; - added an option to prevent colonists from taking joy activities if they're already topped of(after reaching 95%, they'll not start it again until it's down to 80%);

- fixed a problem, when material of an item could change with "all components hauled together" on, because order of picking up could change due to path optimization (basically, whatever was closer to the pawn, it automatically become a main ingredient);

- added some more checks for "random ingredients", to possibly remove any issues with unusual recipes; - rearranged checks for opportunistic cleaning jobs to remove possibilities of pawns ignoring assignments in incapability;

- when pawns unload inventory, their task actually get canceled midway if you unmark items or drop them; - if you unmark items to unload, and pawn doesn't have enough space in inventory, that item is dropped on the ground;

Updated for RimWorld 1.1! Now, that doesn't mean it works at least as good as before, because some things may be broken silently, without me knowing about it, so it may take a bit more time to fine tune everything.
